quotes.quote: Autism is not the end of the world, just the beginning of a new one.
I LOOK AT AUTISM LIKE A BUS ACCIDENT, AND YOU DON'T BECOME CURED FROM A BUS ACCIDENT, BUT YOU CAN RECOVER.
AUTISM IS AN EXTREMELY VARIABLE DISORDER.
Autism doesn't have to define a person. Artists with autism are like anyone else: They define themselves through hard work and individuality.
One of the hardest things for a person with autism to do is believe in themselves. But autistics have every right to be as proud as anyone.
If you can't see the gift in having a child with autism, you're focusing too much on the autism and not enough on the child.
Autism ? offers a chance for us to glimpse an awe-filled vision of the world that might otherwise pass us by.
Autism is not a choice. Acceptance is. Imagine if the opposite was true.
Autism is not a disability, it's a different ability.
I do not suffer from Autism, but I do suffer from the way you treat me.
One thing I'm learning about Autism, is that there is no right or wrong way of living with it.
Autism, like a rainbow, has a bright side and a dark side and even though it can mean rough weather, it can be beautiful.
It's amazing how autism affects the whole family.
I have autism. It is not a disorder or a disease. IGNORANCE is a disorder AND a disease. IT needs to be eradicated.
People with autism don't need wheelchairs, artifical legs, or a guide dog. Their prosthesis is people.
If by some magic, autism had been eradicated from the face of the earth, then men would still be socializing in front of a wood fire at the entrance to a cave.
It seems that for success in science or art, a dash of autism is essential.
Nobel prize-calibre geniuses often have certain core autistic features at their heart.

Think of it: disability is usually defined in terms of what is missing...But autism...is as much about what is abundant as what is missing, an over-expression of the very traits that make our species unique.
Autists are the ultimate square pegs, and the problem with pounding a square peg into a round hole is not that the hammering is hard work. It's that you're destroying the peg.
If I could snap my fingers and be nonautistic, I would not. Autism is part of what I am.
Autism, is part of my child, it's not everything he is. My child is so much more than a diagnosis.
Autism can't define me. I define autism.
Autism is not a disease, rather a disability that every day I strive to become an A-bility.
If you've met one person with autism, you've met one person with autism.
Sometimes all a parent needs is to know the impossible is actually possible. Hope goes a long way when it comes to Autism.
It is never too late to expand the mind of a person on the autism spectrum.
Don't think that there's a different , better child 'hiding' behind the autism. This is your child. Love the child in front of you.
